p: As with the K211E mutation in the ECSA lineage, this mutation also occurs within the CHIKV-WH genotype. This mutation has not been characterized for pathogenesis within this particular genotype though it is thought to be analogous to the K211E mutation in the ECSA lineage, which confers increased infectivity in Ae. aegypti [ 67, 135]. Neonates and infants infected with this genotype during the 2014 outbreak in Norte de Santander, Colombia presented with fever, cutaneous eruptions, and diarrhea [ 64]. Many infants developed severe mucocutaneous, ulcerative lesions, the majority of which occurred in the genital and perianal rejoins [ 64].
